compounds.series_general_formula: Strong monoprotic mineral acids: HX (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Typical strong acid; almost completely dissociated in water; widely used in labs and industry; colorless, pungent solution.

compounds.series_general_formula: Strong monoprotic mineral acids: HX (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Strong acid similar to hydrochloric acid; almost completely dissociated; appears in lists of strong acids in exam prep.

compounds.series_general_formula: Strong monoprotic mineral acids: HX (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Very strong acid; strong reducing properties due to I^-; included among strong acids in many high school lists.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of nitrogen: HNO2, HNO3
compounds.notes: Strong monoprotic acid and powerful oxidizing agent (especially when concentrated); reacts with many metals to form nitrogen oxides.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of sulfur: H2SO4 (strong), H2SO3 (weak)
compounds.notes: Strong diprotic acid; concentrated H2SO4 is highly dehydrating and oxidizing; extremely important industrial chemical.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of sulfur: H2SO3 (weak), H2SO4 (strong)
compounds.notes: Weak diprotic acid; exists only in solution; formed by dissolving SO2 in water; reducing agent in redox reactions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of carbon: H2CO3 (weak, diprotic)
compounds.notes: Weak diprotic acid; forms when CO2 dissolves in water; unstable and exists in solution; gives hydrogencarbonates and carbonates.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of phosphorus: H3PO4 (triprotic)
compounds.notes: Triprotic weak acid; important in fertilizers and biochemistry; gives a series of acid salts and normal phosphate salts.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen halides: HF (weak acid), HCl, HBr, HI (strong acids)
compounds.notes: Weak acid in water but highly corrosive; attacks glass by forming SiF4; handled in plastic containers.

compounds.series_general_formula: Strong bases: MOH (M = alkali metal)
compounds.notes: Typical strong base; white, deliquescent solid; highly soluble in water and strongly alkaline; used in many neutralization and saponification reactions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Strong bases: MOH (M = alkali metal)
compounds.notes: Strong base similar to NaOH; used in alkaline batteries and as absorbent for CO2; representative K+ alkali.

compounds.local_name: 水酸化カルシウム（消石灰）
compounds.series_general_formula: Strong bases (sparingly soluble): M(OH)2 (M = Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: Slightly soluble strong base; saturated solution is limewater; used to detect CO2 and in construction.

compounds.series_general_formula: Strong bases: M(OH)2 (M = Ba)
compounds.notes: Strong base; more soluble than Ca(OH)2; used in titrations and analysis involving sulfate precipitation (BaSO4).

compounds.series_general_formula: Weak bases (sparingly soluble): M(OH)2 (M = Mg, many transition metals)
compounds.notes: White, almost insoluble solid; weak base; used as antacid and flame retardant.

compounds.local_name: アンモニア（アンモニア水）
compounds.series_general_formula: Molecular bases: NH3 and organic amines
compounds.notes: Weak base; accepts protons from water to form NH4^+ and OH^-; typical weak base in high school problems.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric hydroxides: M(OH)n (M = Al, Zn, Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White gelatinous precipitate; amphoteric; dissolves in both acids and concentrated bases; weak base in water.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric hydroxides: M(OH)2 (M = Zn, Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White gelatinous precipitate; amphoteric; dissolves in excess strong base to form zincate ions and in acids to form zinc salts.

compounds.series_general_formula: Weak bases: many transition metal hydroxides M(OH)n
compounds.notes: Blue gelatinous precipitate; typical weak base and sparingly soluble hydroxide; used in qualitative analysis.

compounds.series_general_formula: Weak bases: many transition metal hydroxides M(OH)n
compounds.notes: Brown gelatinous precipitate; weak base; appears in qualitative analysis and weak-base lists.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metals (Group 1): M (M = Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs)
compounds.notes: Soft, silvery metal; highly reactive; stored under kerosene; reacts vigorously with water to form sodium hydroxide and hydrogen.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metals (Group 1): M (M = Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs)
compounds.notes: Very soft, silvery metal; reacts more vigorously with water than sodium; gives violet flame in flame test.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal halides: MX (M = Li, Na, K; X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless ionic crystal; main component of seawater and rock salt; important raw material in chloro-alkali industry.

compounds.local_name: 水酸化ナトリウム（苛性ソーダ）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal hydroxides: MOH (M = Li, Na, K)
compounds.notes: White hygroscopic solid; strong base; deliquescent and used as basic drying agent; produced industrially by ion-exchange membrane process.

compounds.local_name: 水酸化カリウム（苛性カリ）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal hydroxides: MOH (M = Li, Na, K)
compounds.notes: White hygroscopic solid; very strong base; absorbs CO2 and H2O from air; used in alkaline batteries and as a drying agent.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal carbonates: M2CO3 (M = Li, Na, K)
compounds.notes: White crystalline solid; basic salt; used in glass manufacturing, water softening, and as washing soda (decahydrate).

compounds.local_name: 炭酸水素ナトリウム（重曹）
compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogencarbonates: MHCO3 (M = Na, K)
compounds.notes: White crystalline powder; weakly basic; decomposes on heating to Na2CO3, CO2 and H2O; used in baking powders and fire extinguishers.

compounds.series_general_formula: Nitrates: MNO3 (M = alkali or alkaline-earth metal)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystalline solid; strong oxidizing salt; used in fertilizers, gunpowder, and as a source of K+ and NO3^- ions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline earth metals (Group 2): M (M = Be, Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba)

functional_groups.name_ja: アルカリ土類金属イオン

compounds.notes: Light silvery metal; burns with dazzling white flame; used in fireworks and flares; relatively reactive for a metal.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline earth metals (Group 2): M (M = Be, Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba)

functional_groups.name_ja: アルカリ土類金属イオン

compounds.notes: Soft, silvery metal; reacts with cold water to form calcium hydroxide and hydrogen; gives brick-red flame.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline earth metal oxides: MO (M = Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: White solid; basic oxide; used as refractory material and in medicine (antacid); formed by burning magnesium in oxygen.

compounds.local_name: 酸化カルシウム（生石灰）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline earth metal oxides: MO (M = Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: White solid; reacts vigorously with water to form calcium hydroxide and release heat; used as basic drying agent and in cement.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline earth metal hydroxides: M(OH)2 (M = Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: White, sparingly soluble solid; weak base; used as antacid and flame retardant; forms a precipitate in many reactions.

compounds.local_name: 水酸化カルシウム（消石灰）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline earth metal hydroxides: M(OH)2 (M = Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: Slightly soluble base; saturated solution is limewater; used to test for CO2 (forms CaCO3 precipitate).

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline-earth carbonates: MCO3 (M = Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: White solid; main component of limestone, marble, shells; decomposes on heating to quicklime and CO2; used in cement and construction.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric metals: Al, Zn, Sn, Pb
compounds.notes: Light, silvery metal; covered with protective oxide film; reacts with both acids and bases when oxide film is removed; important structural material.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric oxides: M2O3 or MO (M = Al, Zn, Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White, very hard solid; amphoteric oxide that reacts with both acids and bases; main component of bauxite and corundum.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric hydroxides: M(OH)n (M = Al, Zn, Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White gelatinous precipitate; amphoteric; dissolves in both acids and bases to form aluminate and aluminium salts.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric oxides: MO (M = Zn, Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White solid that turns yellow on heating; amphoteric; reacts with both acids and bases; used in ointments, pigments, and rubber industry.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric hydroxides: M(OH)2 (M = Zn, Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White gelatinous precipitate; dissolves in excess strong base to form complex zincate ions and in acids to form zinc salts.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric oxides: MO2 (M = Sn, Pb)
compounds.notes: White solid; amphoteric; reacts with acids to form stannic salts and with bases to form stannate ions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Amphoteric oxides: MO (M = Pb, Sn, Zn)
compounds.notes: Yellow or red solid; amphoteric; reacts with acids and concentrated bases; used historically in glass and ceramics.

compounds.series_general_formula: Chromium and its ions: Cr^{2+}, Cr^{3+}, CrO4^{2-}, Cr2O7^{2-}
compounds.notes: Hard, shiny metal; used for plating (chrome plating); forms many colored compounds and ions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Chromates: M2CrO4 (M = alkali metal)
compounds.notes: Yellow crystals; aqueous solution is yellow due to chromate ion; interconverts with dichromate depending on pH.

compounds.series_general_formula: Dichromates: M2Cr2O7 (M = alkali metal)
compounds.notes: Orange-red crystals; strong oxidizing agent; aqueous solution is orange; interconverts with chromate in acid–base equilibrium.

compounds.series_general_formula: Transition metal oxides: M2O3 (M = Cr, Fe, etc.)
compounds.notes: Green solid; used as green pigment and in polishing powders; amphoteric character; common Cr(III) oxide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Manganese and its ions: Mn^{2+}, Mn^{4+}, MnO4^-
compounds.notes: Gray hard metal; used in steel production; forms many colored compounds with different oxidation states.

compounds.local_name: 酸化マンガン(IV)（二酸化マンガン）
compounds.series_general_formula: Transition metal oxides: MO2 (M = Mn, Sn, etc.)
compounds.notes: Black solid; used as catalyst in decomposition of hydrogen peroxide and as depolarizer in dry cells.

compounds.local_name: 過マンガン酸カリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Permanganates: M MnO4 (M = alkali metal)
compounds.notes: Dark purple crystals; strong oxidizing agent; in acidic solution MnO4^- is reduced to Mn^{2+}; classic oxidizing agent in high-school chemistry.

compounds.series_general_formula: Metal sulfates: MSO4 (M = Mn, Fe, Cu, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless to pale pink crystals; product of reduction of permanganate in acidic solution; used as fertilizer and in industry.

compounds.series_general_formula: Coinage metals: Cu, Ag, Au
compounds.notes: Reddish metal; good conductor of heat and electricity; forms green patina (basic copper carbonate) when exposed to moist air and CO2.

compounds.series_general_formula: Copper oxides: Cu2O, CuO
compounds.notes: Red solid; copper in +1 state; used as pigment and antifouling agent on ship bottoms.

compounds.series_general_formula: Copper oxides: Cu2O, CuO
compounds.notes: Black solid; copper in +2 state; used as pigment and in redox experiments; formed by heating copper in air below ~1000℃.

compounds.series_general_formula: Metal hydroxides: M(OH)n
compounds.notes: Blue gelatinous precipitate; decomposes on heating to CuO and H2O; dissolves in excess ammonia to form deep blue complex.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrated copper(II) salts: CuX2·nH2O
compounds.notes: Blue crystals; common laboratory salt; used in electroplating, analytical chemistry, and as fungicide.

compounds.local_name: テトラアンミン銅(II)イオン
compounds.series_general_formula: Ammine complexes of copper(II): [Cu(NH3)n]^{2+}
compounds.notes: Deep blue complex ion formed when excess aqueous ammonia is added to Cu^{2+} solutions; typical example of complex formation.

compounds.series_general_formula: Coinage metals: Cu, Ag, Au
compounds.notes: Shiny, soft metal with high electrical conductivity; used in jewelry, coins, and electrical contacts.

compounds.series_general_formula: Silver halides: AgX (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: White curdy precipitate; photosensitive; dissolves in excess ammonia to form diamminesilver(I) complex; typical example in qualitative analysis.

compounds.series_general_formula: Metal oxides: M2O (M = Ag, Cu, etc.)
compounds.notes: Brown solid precipitate; formed when OH^- is added to Ag^+; dissolves in ammonia forming complex ions; used in silver-oxide batteries.

compounds.series_general_formula: Ammine complexes of silver(I): [Ag(NH3)2]^+
compounds.notes: Colorless complex ion; formed when excess aqueous ammonia is added to AgCl or Ag2O; important in Tollens' reagent for silver mirror test.

compounds.series_general_formula: Metal sulfides: M2S (M = Ag, Cu, etc.)
compounds.notes: Black solid; forms tarnish on silver objects exposed to sulfur-containing gases; insoluble; typical precipitate of Ag^+ with sulfide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Transition metals (iron family): Fe and its ions Fe^{2+}, Fe^{3+}
compounds.notes: Gray, relatively soft metal; rusts in moist air; forms both +2 and +3 oxidation states; most important structural metal.

compounds.series_general_formula: Iron oxides: FeO, Fe2O3, Fe3O4
compounds.notes: Black solid; iron in +2 state; one of the iron oxides; used in pigments and steelmaking.

compounds.series_general_formula: Iron oxides: FeO, Fe2O3, Fe3O4
compounds.notes: Reddish-brown solid; main component of rust; iron in +3 state; used as pigment and in magnetic materials.

compounds.series_general_formula: Mixed-valence iron oxides: Fe3O4
compounds.notes: Black solid; contains both Fe^{2+} and Fe^{3+}; strongly magnetic; occurs as mineral magnetite.

compounds.series_general_formula: Iron(II) halides: FeX2 (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Pale green solid; Fe^{2+} salt; used as reducing agent and in water treatment.

compounds.series_general_formula: Iron(III) halides: FeX3 (X = Cl, Br)
compounds.notes: Brown solid; Fe^{3+} salt; hydrolyzes in water; used in etching of printed circuit boards and as coagulant in water treatment.

compounds.local_name: ヘキサシアノ鉄(II)酸カリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Hexacyanidoferrate complexes: [Fe(CN)6]^{4-}, [Fe(CN)6]^{3-}
compounds.notes: Colorless to yellow crystals; forms Prussian blue with Fe^{3+}; used to detect Fe^{3+} and in pigment production.

compounds.local_name: ヘキサシアノ鉄(III)酸カリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Hexacyanidoferrate complexes: [Fe(CN)6]^{3-}
compounds.notes: Red crystals; forms Turnbull's blue with Fe^{2+}; used as oxidizing agent and analytical reagent.

compounds.series_general_formula: Allotropes of carbon: graphite, diamond, fullerene
compounds.notes: Soft, black solid; layers of hexagonal carbon sheets; conducts electricity; used as electrode material and lubricant.

compounds.series_general_formula: Allotropes of carbon: graphite, diamond, fullerene
compounds.notes: Transparent, extremely hard crystal; non-conductive; each carbon is tetrahedrally bonded in a three-dimensional network.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxides of carbon: CO, CO2
compounds.notes: Colorless, odorless gas; highly toxic; reducing agent used in metal extraction from ores.

compounds.series_general_formula: Acidic oxides of nonmetals: EO2, EO3 (E = C, S, N, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas; slightly soluble in water to form carbonic acid; product of combustion and respiration; used in carbonation of drinks.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of carbon: H2CO3
compounds.notes: Weak acid formed when carbon dioxide dissolves in water; unstable and exists only in solution; gives rise to carbonate and hydrogencarbonate salts.

compounds.local_name: 炭酸カルシウム（石灰石）
compounds.series_general_formula: Carbonates: MCO3 (M = Ca, Mg, etc.)
compounds.notes: White solid found as limestone, marble, and chalk; decomposes on heating to CaO and CO2; used as building material and in cement.

compounds.series_general_formula: Silicon oxides and silicates: SiO2, SiO3^{2-}
compounds.notes: Hard, chemically stable solid; main component of sand and quartz; used in glass and ceramics.

compounds.local_name: メタケイ酸ナトリウム（水ガラス）
compounds.series_general_formula: Silicates: M2SiO3, M2SiO3·nH2O
compounds.notes: Colorless aqueous solution forms a glassy solid on drying; used as adhesive, fireproofing agent, and in detergents.

compounds.series_general_formula: Carbides: MC, SiC
compounds.notes: Very hard, high-melting solid; used as abrasive and refractory material; example of covalent network solid containing carbon and silicon.

compounds.series_general_formula: Halogen molecules: X2 (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Pale yellow diatomic gas; most electronegative element; very reactive; not usually handled in school labs.

compounds.series_general_formula: Halogen molecules: X2 (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Greenish-yellow diatomic gas; strong oxidizing and bleaching agent; used for disinfection and in the manufacture of many chlorides.

compounds.series_general_formula: Halogen molecules: X2 (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Red-brown liquid at room temperature; volatile, toxic; typical example of halogen that is liquid at room temperature.

compounds.series_general_formula: Halogen molecules: X2 (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Dark violet-black solid that sublimes to a violet vapor; used as disinfectant and in starch test; least reactive common halogen.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen halides: HX (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas or liquid; weak acid in water but highly corrosive; aqueous solution (hydrofluoric acid) etches glass.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen halides: HX (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas with sharp smell; highly soluble in water to form hydrochloric acid, a strong acid widely used in labs and industry.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen halides: HX (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas; aqueous solution is a strong acid (hydrobromic acid); typical example in trend of acidity of hydrogen halides.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen halides: HX (X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas; aqueous solution is hydroiodic acid, one of the strongest common acids; least thermally stable hydrogen halide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxyacids of chlorine: HClO, HClO2, HClO3, HClO4
compounds.notes: Weak oxyacid formed when chlorine dissolves in water; responsible for the bleaching and disinfecting action of chlorine water.

compounds.local_name: 次亜塩素酸ナトリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Hypochlorites: MClO (M = alkali or alkaline-earth metal)
compounds.notes: Active component of household bleach; strong oxidizing and disinfecting agent; produced by reaction of chlorine with cold dilute NaOH.

compounds.series_general_formula: Diatomic nonmetal molecules: X2 (X = H, N, O, F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Lightest element; colorless, odorless diatomic gas; burns in oxygen to form water and acts as a strong reducing agent.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen oxides: H2O, H2O2; general type H2On
compounds.notes: Most abundant compound on Earth; colorless, high boiling point for its molar mass due to hydrogen bonding; universal solvent in high-school chemistry.

compounds.series_general_formula: Peroxides: X2O2 with peroxide ion O2^{2-}
compounds.notes: Colorless liquid; stronger oxidizing agent than water; used as bleach and disinfectant; decomposes to water and oxygen.

compounds.series_general_formula: Noble gases: Group 18 monoatomic gases
compounds.notes: Noble gas; monoatomic, very low boiling point; lighter than air and nonflammable so used for balloons and airships.

compounds.series_general_formula: Noble gases: Group 18 monoatomic gases
compounds.notes: Noble gas; emits red-orange light in discharge tubes; typical example of chemically inert gas at high-school level.

compounds.series_general_formula: Noble gases: Group 18 monoatomic gases
compounds.notes: Noble gas used as inert atmosphere for welding and incandescent light bulbs; colorless, odorless, and very unreactive.

compounds.series_general_formula: Noble gases: Group 18 monoatomic gases; heavier members can form compounds with F and O
compounds.notes: Heavy noble gas; used in high-intensity lamps and anesthesia; forms stable fluorides such as XeF2 and XeF4 under special conditions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Xenon fluorides: XeFn (n = 2, 4, 6)
compounds.notes: Stable xenon fluoride; strong fluorinating and oxidizing agent; typical example showing that noble gases can form compounds.

compounds.series_general_formula: Xenon fluorides: XeFn (n = 2, 4, 6)
compounds.notes: First binary noble-gas compound discovered; colorless crystalline solid with square-planar geometry; strong fluorinating and oxidizing agent.

compounds.series_general_formula: Diatomic nonmetal molecules: X2 (X = H, N, O, F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless, odorless diatomic gas; makes up about 78% of air; very inert due to strong triple bond.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen chalcogenides and pnictides: EH3 (E = N, P, As)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas with sharp smell; very soluble in water and forms weakly basic solution; important fertilizer raw material (Haber process).

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxides of nitrogen: NO, NO2, N2O, N2O3, N2O5
compounds.notes: Colorless gas; sparingly soluble in water; easily oxidized in air to brown nitrogen dioxide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxides of nitrogen: NO, NO2, N2O, N2O3, N2O5
compounds.notes: Brown gas with pungent smell; toxic and strongly oxidizing; dissolves in water to form a mixture of nitric and nitrous acids.

compounds.local_name: 一酸化二窒素（亜酸化窒素）
compounds.series_general_formula: Oxides of nitrogen: NO, NO2, N2O, N2O3, N2O5
compounds.notes: Colorless gas with slightly sweet odor; used as anesthetic (laughing gas); mild oxidizing agent.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of nitrogen: HNO2, HNO3
compounds.notes: Strong acid and powerful oxidizing agent; reacts with many metals to form nitrogen oxides; used for fertilizers and explosives.

compounds.series_general_formula: Allotropes of phosphorus: white (P4), red, black
compounds.notes: Waxy, white-yellow solid that glows in the dark; very reactive and ignites in air; stored under water.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of phosphorus: H3PO4, H3PO3, H3PO2
compounds.notes: Triprotic acid; weaker than sulfuric or nitric acid; important in fertilizers and biological energy transfer (ATP).

compounds.local_name: 五酸化二リン（四リン十酸化物）
compounds.series_general_formula: Oxides of phosphorus: P4O6, P4O10 (often written as P2O3, P2O5)
compounds.notes: Acidic oxide of phosphorus; strong dehydrating agent; reacts with water to give phosphoric acid; textbook example of acidic oxide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Diatomic nonmetal molecules: X2 (X = H, N, O, F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless, odorless diatomic gas; supports combustion and respiration; makes up about 21% of air by volume.

compounds.series_general_formula: Allotropes of oxygen: O2 and O3
compounds.notes: Pale blue gas with sharp smell; strong oxidizing agent; forms ozone layer that absorbs ultraviolet radiation.

compounds.series_general_formula: Peroxides: X2O2 with peroxide ion O2^{2-}
compounds.notes: Colorless liquid; strong oxidizing agent; used as bleach and disinfectant; decomposes to water and oxygen, catalyzed by MnO2 and enzymes.

compounds.series_general_formula: Allotropes of sulfur: rhombic, monoclinic, and plastic sulfur; molecular form S8
compounds.notes: Yellow solid with several allotropes; burns in air with blue flame to form sulfur dioxide; important nonmetal element.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogen chalcogenides: H2E (E = O, S, Se)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas with rotten-egg odor; weak acid and strong reducing agent; highly toxic; prepared from metal sulfides and acids.

compounds.series_general_formula: Acidic oxides of nonmetals: EO2, EO3 (E = S, C, N, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless gas with pungent smell; weakly acidic and acts as both oxidizing and reducing agent; used as preservative and in sulfuric acid production.

compounds.series_general_formula: Acidic oxides of nonmetals: EO3 (E = S, N, P, etc.)
compounds.notes: Acidic oxide of sulfur; reacts vigorously with water to form sulfuric acid; industrial intermediate in the contact process.

compounds.series_general_formula: Oxoacids of sulfur: H2SO4, H2SO3
compounds.notes: Strong diprotic acid; concentrated sulfuric acid is dehydrating and oxidizing; one of the most important industrial chemicals.

compounds.series_general_formula: Carbonates: M2CO3 (M = alkali metal), MCO3 (M = alkaline-earth metal)
compounds.notes: White crystalline solid; basic salt; highly soluble in water; used in glass manufacturing and as washing soda (decahydrate).

compounds.local_name: 炭酸水素ナトリウム（重曹）
compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrogencarbonates: MHCO3 (M = Na, K, NH4)
compounds.notes: White crystalline powder; weakly basic; used in baking powders and fire extinguishers; decomposes on heating to Na2CO3, CO2, and H2O.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal carbonates: M2CO3 (M = Na, K, etc.)
compounds.notes: White solid; strongly basic; highly soluble in water; used in glass making, detergents, and as desiccant for organic solvents.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline-earth carbonates: MCO3 (M = Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba)
compounds.notes: White solid; poorly soluble; main component of limestone, marble, shells; decomposes by heating to CaO and CO2.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline-earth carbonates: MCO3 (M = Mg, Ca, etc.)
compounds.notes: White solid; poorly soluble; used as drying agent and in gymnastics and climbing chalk.

compounds.series_general_formula: Ammonium carbonates: (NH4)2CO3, NH4HCO3
compounds.notes: White solid; decomposes easily to NH3, CO2 and H2O; used historically as smelling salts and in baking.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal halides: MX (M = alkali metal; X = F, Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: Colorless ionic crystals; highly soluble; typical neutral salt; produced by evaporating seawater and mining rock salt.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkali metal halides: MX (M = alkali metal; X = Cl, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; highly soluble; used as fertilizer and in KCl–NaCl eutectic mixtures.

compounds.series_general_formula: Alkaline-earth halides: MX2 (M = Mg, Ca, etc.)
compounds.notes: White, very hygroscopic crystals; used as drying agent and de-icing agent; highly soluble in water.

compounds.series_general_formula: Transition metal chlorides: MCl2 (M = Cu, Fe, etc.)
compounds.notes: Green crystals (dihydrate) or brown powder; soluble in water giving blue-green solutions; used in qualitative analysis.

compounds.series_general_formula: Transition metal chlorides: MCl3 (M = Fe, Al, etc.)
compounds.notes: Brown crystals; hydrolyzes in water to give acidic solution; used as coagulant in water treatment and in PCB etching.

compounds.series_general_formula: Sparingly soluble halides: AgX, PbX2 (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: White curdy precipitate; almost insoluble in water; forms in qualitative analysis test for Cl^-; dissolves in excess NH3 as [Ag(NH3)2]^+.

compounds.series_general_formula: Sparingly soluble halides: PbX2 (X = Cl, Br, I)
compounds.notes: White crystalline solid; poorly soluble in cold water but more soluble in hot water; typical example in solubility rules.

compounds.series_general_formula: Nitrates: MNO3 (M = metal, NH4)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; highly soluble; used in fertilizers and explosives; example of "all nitrates are soluble" rule.

compounds.series_general_formula: Nitrates: MNO3 (M = metal, NH4)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystalline solid; strongly oxidizing; used in gunpowder and fertilizers; classic nitrate example.

compounds.series_general_formula: Ammonium nitrates: NH4NO3
compounds.notes: Highly soluble solid; important nitrogen fertilizer and component of some explosives; typical salt combining NH4^+ and NO3^-.

compounds.series_general_formula: Nitrates: MNO3 (M = Ag, Cu, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; highly soluble; used in analytical chemistry to precipitate halides (AgCl, AgBr, AgI) and as disinfectant.

compounds.series_general_formula: Metal nitrates: M(NO3)n
compounds.notes: Blue crystals (hydrates); typical colored nitrate; used in preparation of copper compounds and as oxidizing agent.

compounds.series_general_formula: Acid sulfates: MHSO4 (M = Na, K)
compounds.notes: Acid salt of sulfuric acid; forms acidic aqueous solution; typical example of acid salt in neutralization problems.

compounds.local_name: 次亜塩素酸ナトリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Hypochlorites: MClO (M = Na, Ca, etc.)
compounds.notes: Active component of bleach; strong oxidizing and disinfecting agent; produced by reacting Cl2 with cold dilute NaOH.

compounds.series_general_formula: Nitrites: MNO2 (M = Na, K, etc.)
compounds.notes: White to pale yellow solid; used in food preservation and as intermediate in diazotization reactions; contrasts with nitrates NO3^-.

compounds.series_general_formula: Metal sulfides: M2S (M = alkali metal), MS (M = many metals)
compounds.notes: Colorless to yellow solid; strongly basic and reducing; used in qualitative inorganic chemistry for sulfide precipitation.

compounds.series_general_formula: Ammonium salts: NH4X (X = Cl, NO3, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; solution is weakly acidic due to NH4^+ hydrolysis; used in dry cells and as fertilizer.

compounds.local_name: ミョウバン（硫酸カリウムアルミニウム十二水和物）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alums (double sulfates): MAl(SO4)2·12H2O (M = K, NH4, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; double salt of K+, Al3+ and SO4^{2-}; used in water purification, mordant dyeing, and as common "alum" in daily life.

compounds.local_name: チオ硫酸ナトリウム五水和物（ハイポ）
compounds.series_general_formula: Thiosulfates: M2S2O3 (M = Na, etc.)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; used in photography as fixing agent and in iodine titrations; typical complex anion salt.

compounds.local_name: 二水素リン酸ナトリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Acid phosphates: MH2PO4 (M = Na, K, NH4)
compounds.notes: Acid salt of phosphoric acid; used in buffer solutions; typical example of acid phosphate.

compounds.local_name: 水素リン酸ナトリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Acid phosphates: M2HPO4 (M = Na, K)
compounds.notes: Another acid salt of phosphoric acid; used together with NaH2PO4 to make buffer solutions.

compounds.series_general_formula: Normal phosphates: M3PO4 (M = alkali metal)
compounds.notes: Strongly basic salt; used in detergents and water softening; typical normal phosphate.

compounds.series_general_formula: Insoluble phosphates: M3(PO4)2 (M = Ca, etc.)
compounds.notes: White, poorly soluble solid; main component of bones and apatite minerals; used in fertilizers.

compounds.local_name: 二水素リン酸アンモニウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Ammonium acid phosphates: NH4H2PO4
compounds.notes: Soluble phosphate fertilizer; provides both nitrogen and phosphorus; typical ammonium phosphate salt.

compounds.series_general_formula: Sulfates: M2SO4 (M = alkali metal), MSO4 (M = alkaline-earth, transition metal)
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; highly soluble in water; neutral salt used in labs (Glauber's salt is decahydrate).

compounds.series_general_formula: Sulfates: MSO4 (M = Ca, Ba, etc.)
compounds.notes: Slightly soluble white solid; occurs as gypsum (CaSO4·2H2O); used in plaster and as example of limited solubility of sulfates.

compounds.series_general_formula: Insoluble sulfates: BaSO4, PbSO4, SrSO4
compounds.notes: White solid; very insoluble; used as contrast agent in X-ray imaging and as classic example of sulfate precipitate.

compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrated metal sulfates: MSO4·nH2O
compounds.notes: Blue crystals; typical colored salt; used in electroplating, agriculture (fungicide), and as teaching reagent.

compounds.local_name: 硫酸マグネシウム七水和物
compounds.series_general_formula: Hydrated metal sulfates: MSO4·nH2O
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; used in medicine and agriculture; typical example of hydrated sulfate.

compounds.series_general_formula: Ammonium sulfates: (NH4)2SO4
compounds.notes: Colorless crystals; widely used nitrogen fertilizer; typical salt containing both NH4^+ and SO4^{2-}.
